title: Mets' Yoenis Cespedes feeling 'a lot better,' expects to be ready for World Series
text:
Mets' Yoenis Cespedes feeling 'a lot better,' expects to be ready for World Series League Championship Series - New York Mets v Chicago Cubs - Game Three Yoenis Cespedes expects to be ready for Game 1 of the World Series. (Photo by Elsa/Getty Images) (Elsa) Comments 
NEW YORK â€” Yoenis Cespedes attended the Mets ' mandatory workout at Citi Field on Saturday but refrained from participating in baseball activities in order to give his ailing shoulder more time to heal. 
"Compared to the first day when the pain started, I feel a lot better," Cespedes said. "I could probably do something today, but I don't want to do anything. I don't want to push myself. I want to give myself another day before I really start doing stuff again." 
When asked if he thinks he'll be ready in time for Game 1 of the World Series on Tuesday, Cespedes said, "Yeah." 
"I don't think it's going to limit me," he added. "Honestly if I didn't feel 100 percent, I would not have a problem just stepping down and saying that I can't play. But I think I'll be ready." 
PLUS : Matt Harvey will start Game 1 of World Series 
Cespedes left Game 4 of the National League Championship Series with a left shoulder injury and received a cortisone shot on Thursday. He said he believes he sustained the injury while doing pushups in Chicago. 
"I can't be 100 percent sure, but what I can say is that I've never liked doing pushups," Cespedes said. "Those two days over there, I was doing pushups because I didn't have a gym I could do other workouts in." 
Since the Mets will play Game 1 on the road at Kansas City, they'd have the option of using Cespedes as their designated hitter if he still isn't feeling 100 percent. However, Cespedes said he doesn't enjoy being the DH because he doesn't feel as engaged with the game. 
"Even if I'm not feeling 100 percent out there, I'd still want to play," Cespedes said. "I don't like being the designated hitter. I don't feel like I'm part of the game."
